page.title: 14SUNDAY SCHOOL SURVEY
page.content: We carried out a school survey to find out children's attitudes towards Church and Sunday School. We discovered that only 22% of the children attend Sunday School, whilst 41% have never been and 37% used to go but have given up. Nineteen per cent of parents attend Church (see graph page 15); 78% of parents and 91% of grandparents used to attend when they were children. We asked the Vicar of Holy Trinity Church if he knew why less people attended Church these days. He said that according to Parish records, the number of people attending regularly hasn't changed much over the last 50 years. He thinks that, as people get older, they only remember the big occasions and, in fact, most people who say they went, only went once or twice a year.
